intro: Trichomanes ignobile, commonly known as the noble water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, which helps it retain moisture. Trichomanes ignobile is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in controlled environments.
